name: Mexican Pinto Beans
author: LAGIRL
summary: Slightly spicy beans similar to those served as a side dish in authentic Mexican restaurants.
directions: Place the beans in a large pot with enough water to cover by 3 to 4 inches, and bring to a boil
Remove from heat, and let sit 1 hour
Pour in enough fresh water to cover beans by 3 to 4 inches, and bring to a boil
Reduce heat, cover, and simmer 1 hour
Place bacon in a skillet, and cook over medium high heat until evenly brown
Crumble bacon, and transfer, along with grease, to the pot with the beans
Continue to cook beans on low heat for 30 minutes
Place the whole chile peppers into the pot, and continue cooking beans 1 hour, or until tender
